newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-CAMPESE VICTORIOUS IN FINAL TEST APPEARANCE.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-CAMPESE VICTORIOUS IN FINAL TEST APPEARANCE.

text.p: Wales did their best to spoil David Campese's final test appearance on Sunday but could not prevent Australia completing a clean sweep of international victories on their tour of Europe.

The Wallabies won 28-19 at Cardiff Arms Park, weathering a second-half fightback from the home side who trailed 18-6 at half-time before finally clinching victory with a penalty try in the last minute.

Welsh hopes were dramatically re-ignited 13 minutes into the second-half when centre Gareth Thomas intercepted a pass from George Gregan and raced 90 metres to score under the Wallaby posts to bring his side within two points.
Jonathan Davies converted and then landed his fourth successful penalty to put Wales 19-18 ahead with 20 minutes left, but the Wallabies deservedly finished on top.

Campese had a quiet match on his 101st and final appearance as Australian full-back Matthew Burke completed a personal haul of 18 points. In the process he established a world record for the highest test aggregate scored by one player in a calendar year.
